concise_definition: adv. 几乎不, 刚刚, 仅仅

definitions.explanation_en: To an extent that is just sufficient or barely noticeable; indicating something happens with great difficulty or by a very small margin.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某事刚刚达到最低限度，或几乎无法察觉；表示某事以极小的差距勉强发生，或极其困难地完成。
definitions.example_en: She barely passed the exam by scoring one point above the passing grade.
definitions.example_cn: 她仅以高出及格线一分的成绩勉强通过了考试。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to emphasize that something is almost not true or almost did not happen, often implying surprise or relief.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于强调某事几乎不成立或几乎没发生，常带有惊讶或庆幸的语气。
definitions.example_en: We barely made it to the airport before the flight departed.
definitions.example_cn: 我们差点就没赶上飞机起飞前到达机场。

definitions.explanation_en: In a way that is minimal or insufficient, often suggesting insufficiency or lack of adequacy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指程度极低或不足，常暗示某种匮乏或不充分。
definitions.example_en: He could barely hear the speaker over the noise of the crowd.
definitions.example_cn: 在人群的喧闹声中，他几乎听不清演讲者的声音。

comparison.analysis: “Hardly” 与 “barely” 意义非常接近，常可互换，都表示“几乎不”。但 “hardly” 更常用于否定语境，语气更书面化；而 “barely” 更强调“勉强达到”或“仅差一点”，常带有“侥幸”或“极限”的意味。
“Scarcely” 与 “barely” 同义，但更正式，多用于文学或书面语，常与 “when” 连用（如 scarcely had he left...）。它更强调“数量极少”或“时间极短”，而 “barely” 更侧重于“勉强实现”或“边缘状态”。
“Only” (仅仅) 表示限制或最小范围，但不隐含“勉强”或“困难”的含义。例如 “I only ate one apple” 仅说明数量，而 “I barely ate one apple” 暗示吃一个苹果都极其困难。因此 “barely” 比 “only” 更强调过程的艰难或临界状态。
